15 
all that is necessary to be said about them here is that 
their zoological evidence agrees with that of the 
rest of the skeleton. They consist of <s>7<\s> seven cervicals, <s>13<\s> thirteen dorsals 
six lumbars, six sacrals, and six caudals. 
<u>Scapula<\u>. The scapula in common with that of Ovis differs from 
that of ox in the straightness of its spine, in the curvature 
of the dorsal edge, & the small size of the acrom<s>a<\s>ion, <s>the humer<\s> 
<u>Humerus<\u>. The humerus presents the following characteristics 
the deltoid ridge is smaller and less everted the superior 
tuberosity is more massive and the ridge running 
from the deltoid to the outer side of the proximal articulation 
is less marked than in the corresponding ox bone, the 
bone itself is also more slender 
<u>Radius<\u>. The radius presents the following differences from 
that of Bos, the tuberosity on the exterior on the proximal 
end is further removed from the articulation and the 
bone itself is smoother and rounder, the muscular 
impressions are not so strongly marked. 
<u>Ulna<\u>. The superior surface of the olecranon is rounded 
and is much stouter than in Bos or Bison in which 
it ends in a sharp ridge, the transverse diameter 
of the proximal articulation is also greater, the groove 
at the point of anchylosis with the radius is also absent,  
all these are ovine characters. 
Metacarpal - the metacarpal is shorter and stouter than that 
of ox its <s>superior<\s> dorsal surface bears the merest trace 
of an adductor groove. The cavity between the articulations
